audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker introducing himself and mentioning "breaking news". He says that in the video he will be talking about "the recent sightings of the new moon". His tone is conversational and energetic. This is accompanied by loud ambient sounds from the outdoors. Birds are chirping. Then the speaker says "Now on June the 20th, I woke up in the midst of my day of remembrance celebration" for those who follow his channel.

The clip starts with a male speaker talking about blowing his shofar and receiving a report of an early sighting of the new moon. He mentions previous instances of early sightings, including one in 2022, and how they were able to disprove them and stay on track. He speaks in a conversational tone.

The clip begins with a male speaker discussing moon sightings, specifically in Phoenix, Arizona and Aguin, California, including an absence of reports from Santa Clarita, with a conversational tone. The speaker continues listing dates of the sightings, expressing surprise that the moon was cited earlier than expected. He mentions reporting and disproving claims using scripture but states that July 18 sighting is more challenging to disprove. The speaker speculates this could indicate being in spring longer than expected, then prompts the listener to look at Enoch to verify the plausibility of these sightings. The clip ends with static noise.

The audio begins with a male speaker promoting a Bible app, noting that it includes the King James Bible, apocrypha, and hidden books. He sounds informative and engaging. Following his speech, there's a distinct sound of someone manipulating a phone.

The clip begins with a male speaker introducing a section from First Enoch, promising to discuss the Book of the Revolutions of the Luminaries of Heaven and the new moon. His tone is instructional, aiming to clarify certain translations for the listener. He mentions using a Lawrence translation while acknowledging others might be clearer. He plans to talk about this topic in future videos. A faint sound of birds chirping is audible in the background. The male speaker then transitions to a particular verse, dismissing the preceding verses as general information before briefly mentioning the band "Rock Alba" may have released a new song, demonstrating a brief digression from the initial topic.

A man with a calm, focused speaking tone begins by referencing verse seven, describing how the new moon works in relation to the sun's rising and setting. He explains how they rise together initially and the need to use this information when visibility is hindered. Continuing, he elaborates that on the day of the new moon, the sun and moon will rise together, while on the previous day, they will set together. Then, on the evening when the moon is visualized, they will no longer set together, providing space to see the new moon.
The clip begins with a male speaker discussing verifying the sighting of a new moon, aiming to disprove it but finding that is not the case. His tone is conversational.

A male speaker begins by suggesting to examine information on a specific website, then redirects to a potentially quicker method by consulting National Weather Services for sun and moon tables. He then highlights the sun's rise and set times for June 19th, 2023, noting similarities across the 18th, 19th, and 20th, before proceeding to examine the moon data.

The clip begins with a male speaker who is referring to someone named Enoch. He describes what happened on the 18th, stating "the moon rose with the sun". The speaker references that the sun was at "5:04" and the moon rose at "5:01". He continues to quote verse seven, explaining that "when the sun rises, the moon rises with it, receiving a half a portion of its light". He then references the previous verse. The tone is conversational with a didactic feel.

The clip begins with a male speaker analyzing data related to the sun and moon, specifically their setting times, emphasizing the fact that they set together and rose together. The speaker also refers to what Enoch says about it. The speaker then shifts the discussion to the sighting of the new moon, mentioning how the moon receives a portion of its light. After this, the speaker refers to a weather website indicating that some requirements were met except for the light portion. The speaker then moves on to an app and goes back to the 18th, noting sunset and the amount of light.

The clip begins with an earnest male speaker addressing the listener directly, noting a subject is "a big deal" due to the sacred calendar and the timing of the sun and moon's convergence. He suggests that the new moon sighting on June 18th is too early, hinting at an extended Spring season. He notes the cold weather he is experiencing in West Virginia and encourages collaboration and information sharing to clarify this matter, emphasizing the importance of accuracy for upcoming observances. He continues to encourage listeners to work together in the comment section to get everything worked out and look for future videos because the topic is extremely important. Finally, he asks listeners to pray for them as they travel toward DC, suggests that any video suggestions can be posted for their consideration. The speaker expresses his appreciation and delivers a final blessing.
